The negotiator. must now take place first in companies, rather than at branch or confederation level #NSlesEchos
The monopoly of the presentation of trade unions in professional elections must be questioned ►► http://t.co/sz1lIgjJYB #NSlesEchos
Economic redundancy must be made possible even to reorganize the business when there is still time #NSlesEchos
I propose to remove the threshold of 10 employees for staff delegates ... #NSlesEchos
... and to merge all the employee representation bodies with more than 50 employees ►► http://t.co/sz1lIgjJYB #NSlesEchos
If a company wants to get out of the 35 hours, it must be able to do it ►► http://t.co/sz1lIgjJYB #NSlesEchos
We must lead to a simplification of the rules for calculating and paying the contributions of self-employed workers #NSlesEchos
We must return to the degressivity of unemployment benefits from 12 months to encourage the return to employment #NSlesEchos
We must gradually reduce the level of taxation that weighs on companies to the European average #NSlesEchos
The company must be the heart of our pol Eco, our priority, I would even say our obsession - NS ►► http://t.co/sz1lIgjJYB #NSlesEchos
Our compatriots must know: there is a way out. -NS ►► http://t.co/sz1lIgjJYB #NSlesEchos http://t.co/w5Q9R5JZ12

#UNGA70 The @UN has withstood the test of time, has evolved and become a stronger Organization.
It has succeeded in preventing another world war, but challenges have remained: inter & intra-State conflicts, terrorism and abject poverty.
#UNGA70 To solve these challenges, the @UN must seek to forge strategic partnerships with regional and sub-regional organizations.
For the first time, the Palestinian flag was raised at @UN building. 30 September a historic day for them. http://t.co/n3jx90OMVQ
While some efforts have been made to reform the UN Security Council, it is the wish of Member States to see an acceleration of the reforms.
#UNGA70 For the United Nations Security Council to remain what it was 70 years ago is incomprehensible and, to say the least, unacceptable.
#UNGA70 The biggest lesson from the #Ebola epidemic: The world needs to be better prepared to prevent & respond to epidemics in the future.
On Israel and Palestine: Dialogue to resolve the conflict should resume. Tanzania has subscribed to the Two-State solution, in that regard.
Find on the link, my statement at the General Debate of the 70th session of the United Nations General Assembly: http://t.co/6iC23pZWAc

"The Iran deal was a notable bright spot this year. New Zealand is proud that this occurred during our Presidency in July." #UNGA
"We are doing what we can to help the victims of the Syrian conflict and to combat the scourge of ISIL." #UNGA
"It’s time for the Council to stop talking about what’s right and do what’s right." #UNGA
"We believe small states have a positive contribution to make and we want to provide a voice for those who go unheard too often." #UNGA
"We want to contribute to a Council that is genuinely focused on finding practical solutions to political problems." #UNGA
"Healthy and productive oceans are a key requirement for a sustainable future." #UNGA
"I was pleased to announce earlier this week the creation a marine sanctuary around New Zealand’s Kermadec Islands." #UNGA
"The Kermadec Ocean Sanctuary will comprise 620,000 km2 of ocean in one of the most pristine and special environments on Earth." #UNGA
"New Zealand is committed to managing our oceans responsibly and we are working with our Pacific neighbours to do the same." #UNGA
"As I prepare to leave New York, I do so proud of the contribution that New Zealand has made to the sustainable development of our oceans."
"I leave proud of the contribution New Zealand is making on the Security Council." #UNGA
